# selectText(_:)

**Instance Method**

Selects text in the currently selected cell or in the key cell.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func selectText(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Discussion

If the currently selected cell is editable and enabled, its text is selected. Otherwise, the key cell is selected.

## Related Documentation

- **selectText(_:)**: Ends editing in the text field and, if it’s selectable, selects the entire text content.
- **keyCell**: The cell that will be clicked when the user presses the Space bar.

## Editing Text in Cells

- **selectText(atRow:column:)**: Selects the text in the cell at the specified location and returns the cell.
- **textShouldBeginEditing(_:)**: Requests permission to begin editing text.
- **textDidBeginEditing(_:)**: Invoked when there’s a change in the text after the receiver gains first responder status.
- **textDidChange(_:)**: Invoked when a key-down event or paste operation occurs that changes the receiver’s contents.
- **textShouldEndEditing(_:)**: Requests permission to end editing.
- **textDidEndEditing(_:)**: Invoked when text editing ends.
